intro: Apluda varia subsp. aristata, commonly known as the tufted apluda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
